snippet: In N.F.L. games, coaches often call timeouts seconds before a field-goal in order to distract the kicker, but the practice has some questioning whether it’s effective.
abstract: NFL coaches often call timeouts seconds before a field-goal in order to distract the kicker, but the practice has some questioning its effectiveness.
lead_paragraph: In N.F.L. games, coaches often call timeouts seconds before a field-goal in order to distract the kicker, but the practice has some questioning whether it’s effective.

headline.seo: Icing Field-Goal Kickers — Some Are Shaken, Others Are Stirred
headline.main: Icing Tactic Leaves Some Kickers Neither Shaken nor Stirred
headline.print_headline: Icing Tactic Doesn’t Seem to Leave Field-Goal Kickers Shaken or Stirred
